Package chess

Class Game

java.lang.Object
chess.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
Game represents an instance of a chess game Contains method that controls the game, keeps track of turns, valid moves, checks etc.
Author:
Vincent Phung, William McFarland

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Game()
    Class constructor to create a new game instance.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean canMove​(Square[][] board, Square curSquare, Square destSquare)
    Determines whether the piece on the currently selected square can move to the destination square successfully.
    boolean isCheck​(Square[][] board, Square curSquare)
    Determines if the selected square can be attacked by an enemy piece

    Determines if there are no possible moves that can get a king out of check.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Class constructor to create a new game instance. Initializes board and the game settings such as turn.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Method to start a game. Takes in user input until the game is over and displays the chess board.

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove​(Square[][] board, Square curSquare, Square destSquare)
      Determines whether the piece on the currently selected square can move to the destination square successfully. Does not check if the move puts their King in check.
      Parameters:
      board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
      curSquare - The currently selected square.
      destSquare - The destination square that the user wants to move to.
      Returns:
      true if the piece on curSquare can successfully move to destSquare.

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece​(Square[][] board, Square curSquare, Square destSquare)
      Moves the piece on the currently selected square to the destination square
      Parameters:
      board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
      curSquare - The currently selected square.
      destSquare - The destination square that the user wants to move to.

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck​(Square[][] board, Square curSquare)
      Determines if the selected square can be attacked by an enemy piece
      Parameters:
      board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
      curSquare - The currently selected square to check.
      Returns:
      True if the currently selected square can be attacked by an enemy.

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate​(Square[][] board, Square kingSquare)
      Determines if there are no possible moves that can get a king out of check. There are possibilities to get out of check: 1.King moves out of check , 2. Another piece blocks the attacker, 3. The attacking piece is captured.
      Parameters:
      board - Contains the state of all of the squares/pieces on the board.
      kingSquare - The square that the king is located on.
      Returns:
      True if all checks fail then there are no possible moves that can get a king out of check.
